abstract: The Philadelphia Orchestra management and musicians said on Thursday that they had approved a labor agreement that represents a major step toward bringing the orchestra out of bankruptcy court.
snippet: The Philadelphia Orchestra management and musicians said on Thursday that they had approved a labor agreement that represents a major step toward bringing the orchestra out of bankruptcy court.
lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia Orchestra management and musicians said on Thursday that they had approved a labor agreement that represents a major step toward bringing the orchestra out of bankruptcy court. The agreement would drastically cut salaries, reduce the size of the orchestra and pull the musicians out of the nationwide union pension plan, according to the musicians.

headline.main: Philadelphia Orchestra Management and Musicians Approve Labor Agreement
